div.head: Jobe Corner. Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. The ninth day of November in the year of
our Lord God 1676 I Jobe Corner of Charles County planter being such and weake
of body but of sound and perfect minde and menmory blessed be God for the
same and calling to minde the uncertain and transitory Estate of this life
and that all flesh must yeild to Death being desirous to settling things
in order
in order do make this my last will and testament in manner and form
following that is to say first and principally I commit my soule to
Almighty God my Creator and my boddy to the earth from where it
was taken to be buried in Christian and Decent manner according to
the directions of my friend hereafter nominated and appointed

Item I will and Desire that all my Just and Lawfull dets which I
may be paid and satisfied by my wife Ann Corner by me here
appointed my whole & sole Executor.

Item. I give unto my wife Ann Corner my mare Jimmy and her fole.
Item. I give unto my wife Ann all my cattle and hoggs in general.

Item. I will and desire that my wife Ann may have plantation to live on
during her life.

Item. I give and bestow and hereby freely grant unto my beloved friend
Thomas Corker all my 300 acres to be fully
populate thereafter the Death of Ann my wife to his heirs Executors what
follows uninteligable.

Item. I will and Desire that the said Thomas Corker may see me buried
in decent manner and and diploy the Expences out of my Tobacco.

Item. I give my household good and all the rest of my Estate after there my
Legacies and Just Debates are paid unto my dear wife and aforementioned Executor

Last I hereby utterly revoke all former and other wills either by word or
writing ordaining this & no other my last will and testmanet
In witness whereof I have hereunto set my hand and seal this 9th
day of November 1676

Signed Sealed & Delivered
In the presence of us
Thom. Corker -Phillip Browne.
Jobe Corner

On the back of the aforegoing will was endored the following probate to will
April 16th 1677. By virtue of a commission from the hon. bearing
date the 30th day of November 1676 I did the day above written call before
my Elizabeth Corker who made oath that she saw Jobe Corner Deceased
sign sealed and published the withing writing as his last will and testmanet
and that then he was in perfect sense and memory.
4 1/2 sides
Benjamin Rozer
